Boolean Algebra

Apr 14, 2019 • zangsy

  1. A, B and C in the follwoing are all binary.

  2. ¬ means not.

  • OR rules
    • A + 1 = 1​
    • A + 0 = A​
    • A + A = A
  • AND rules
    • A 1 = A​
    • A 0 = 0
    • A A = A
  • Commutative
    • A + B = B + A​
    • A B = B A
  • Associative
    • (A + B) + C = A + (B + C)​
    • (A B) C = A (B C)​

  • Distributive

    • A (B + C) = A B + A C​

    • (A + B) (A + C) = A + B C​

      • (A + B) (A + C) = A A + A C + B A + B C = A + A C + B A + B C = A (1 + C + B) + B C = A 1 + B C = A + B C

  • Complements
    • A + ¬A = 1
    • A ¬A = 0​

  • Absorption

    • A + A B = A

      • A + A B = A (1 + B) = A 1 = A​

    • A + ¬A B = A + B​

      • A + ¬A B = A + A B + ¬A B = A + B (A + ¬A) = A + B 1 = A + B​

    • A (A + B) = A​

      • A (A + B) = A (A + ¬A B) = A A + A ¬A B = A + 0 B = A​

    • A (¬A + B) = A B​

  • Reduction

    • A B + ¬A B = B​

    • (A + B) (¬A + B) = B​

      • (A + B) (¬A + B) = A ¬A + A B + B ¬A + B B = 0 + B (A + ¬A) + B = B 0 + B = B​

  • De Morgan’s Law
    • ¬A + ¬B = ¬(A B)
    • ¬A ¬B = ¬(A + B)
